channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI ‘Friends’ Are No Cure for Loneliness
item.description: Introducing the latest in a dangerous line of counterfeit alternatives to true connection.

item.title: The ‘Affable’ Coach Walz Never Existed
item.description: It was all a myth, peddled by the Democratic apparatus and the media.

item.title: Why Venezuela Needs Repatriation
item.description: To recover, Venezuela needs its people back. Will they return?

item.title: How Will Prospective Venezuelan Oil Production Affect the U.S. Petroleum Market?
item.description: Expect the Trump administration to act to protect U.S. oil producers from downward price pressures, instead of letting the free market work.

item.title: Trump responds to post suggesting Rubio as president of Cuba: 'Sounds good to me'
item.description: President Donald Trump responds to joke about Marco Rubio becoming Cuba's president, as viral memes poke fun at secretary of state's expanding roles.

item.title: I run one of America’s most successful remote work programs and the critics are right. Their solutions are all wrong, though
item.description: Remote work isn't failing our workers. We are failing to lead them.

item.title: A Month in Literary Britain
item.description: Satire and small-town charm can get you through the cold winter months.

item.title: ‘We don’t want to be Americans, we don’t want to be Danes, we want to be Greenlanders’: Local politicians reject Trump
item.description: “If we don’t do it the easy way, we’re going to do it the hard way,” Trump said on Friday, without explaining what that entailed.

item.title: Iran threatens U.S. and Israel as protests enter third week
item.description: The Oslo-based Iran Human Rights group said on Sunday it had confirmed the deaths of at least 192 protesters, including nine individuals under 18.

item.title: Federal judge temporarily blocks DHS termination of Family Reunification Parole programs over notice concerns
item.description: U.S. District Judge Indira Talwani temporarily blocks DHS termination of Family Reunification Parole programs.

item.title: Greenland’s 1.5 million tons of rare earths might never get mined because there just aren’t any roads to them
item.description: The rare earths found there tend to be encased in a complex type of rock called eudialyte, and no profitable extraction process exists for it.

item.title: Somali Maine city councilor resigns days after taking office after felony charge, residency questions
item.description: Lewiston councilor Iman Osman steps down citing racist opposition and personal attacks after being accused of firearm theft and residency violations.

item.title: American protesters brave D.C. chill to call for Iranian regime change
item.description: Amid the rain and cold, Iranian Americans gathered near the White House on Saturday in solidarity with protests across Iran.

item.title: Democrats Want Anti-ICE Protesters To Die So They Can Protect Their Fraudulent Patronage With Riots
